svcproc.title: GENERAL
svcproc.para: It is difficult to determine an exact maintenance interval (time or mileage) since vehicles will be used in a wide variety of operations, applications and conditions.

Vehicles operating under severe conditions such as frequent stop and go driving will require more service maintenance checks than a vehicle used over the road. Therefore, a regular schedule for periodic inspection should be established based on past experience and type of operation.
Disc brakes do not require adjustment since the clearance is maintained by the movement of the caliper piston.

important.para: Keep in mind that the Hydro-Max Brake Booster System consists of two completely separate hydraulic systems that use INCOMPATIBLE FLUIDS: POWER STEERING FLUID for the HYDRO-MAX BOOSTER AND HYDRAULIC BRAKE FLUID for the BRAKE SYSTEM.

svcproc.para: Detailed maintenance information pertaining to power booster and hydraulic systems can be found in the HYDRO MAX BOOSTER SECTION in GROUP 04 - BRAKES, HYDRAULIC in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual.
